About Me

Hello.

Callforce

Full Stack Software Engineer
May, 2020

Callforce provides solutions for patient outreach, answering services and appointment handling, insurance verification, and other unique services to dental offices. I worked alongside FANG-experienced engineers on internal tools, such as an employee console for handling appointments and a list-filtering software that would orgnanize patient records into csvs, for our callers to contact, as well as an external, client-facing portal for our customers to view appointments that required urgent attention.

  • Underwent HIPAA compliance training and am aware of security needed around patient-sensitive data.
  • Built an electron application that filtered millions of patient records based on shared phone numbers, and consolidated them into single records with the oldest patient serving as the primary call-recepient. This software would organize all patients from tens to hundreds of offices under a single umbrella company, a DSO, within a single XLSX file and output office-specific csvs with all patients consolidated to preclude multiple calls to the same phone number in a single execution. The effect of this software reduced operation overhead by dividing up our lists for teams to better manage, prevented multiple calls to the same patient, and provided better accountability for tracking which offices were receiving inadequate attention.
  • Our online applications leveraged the firebase SDK and its nonSQL database; however, as indexes for sorting queries became fewer, we relied more heavily on Google's BigQuery firebase extension for exporting our data into SQL-tables. Consequently, I have a lot of experience writing cloud-functions (onRequests, onCalls, pubsubs, and etc.), writing queries for non-SQL as well as SQL databases, and

Independent Contractor

React/WordPress Developer
Nov, 2019 to Nov, 2020

I worked as a React developer on a map-editing tool for water inspectors leveraging the Konva library for shape building, and I also worked as a WordPress developer for retailconsultingteam and utahconservatives.

  • Experience in cPanel, DNS updates, API service calls, GIT version control, hosting, file management, and creating sharp themes in WordPress using Divi.
  • Update clients daily on requested features and any issues encountered, and implement technologies that best serve the project.
  • Link to RetailConsultingTeam.

Bright Bridge Web

Project Manager && Full Stack Web Developer
Feb, 2019 to Nov, 2019

As an employee at Bright Bridge, I largely worked as a frontend developer specializing in React. Some of the more notable projects I engineered include ScriptureNotes study tool (learn more at scripturenotes.com) and ComplianceGo's Map Editor Tool (functionality will be greatly limited as a public user). I also managed development teams for IAchieveToday and the EventBookingPro app.

  • Correspond with clients with daily updates.
  • Lead weekly standups with task lists and roadmaps, and give directional advice on how to approach complex problems.
  • Keep progress on our weekly goals with end of week reports to share with our clients.
  • Prepare estimates for feature implementations and bug fixes.
  • Organize my teams in a way that play to my team members' strengths while offering room for them to improve upon their weaknesses.
  • I have experience working on UIs and APIs in Django and React.js in Git version control, WordPress, React Native, as well as with working in older legacy code projects using SFTP.
